reviews.author: Sunny0516
reviews.title: Fundamental CS course
reviews.comment_content:
This course will teach fundamental CS and OOP concepts by using C++, including functions / array / scope / structures / pointer / class / stack and queue / new C++11 features (added this semester).

For pointers, we have to learn about linked lists too, and of course these will come along with recursion (functions), dynamic array, memory allocation and leakage.

The regular 11 labs were about:
1 - Basic C++
2 - Basic I/O
3 - Nested Loops
4 - 1D array
5 - 2D array
6 - Recursion
7 - File I/O and string (not accessed in final exam)
8 - Structures
9 - Pointer
10 - Dynamic array and linked list
11 - Classes

Midterms accessed you from basic C++ to functions (recursion, overload, pass by reference, declaration and definition)

Final accessed everything except file I/O, C++ strings and queue structure type.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cecia is one of the best tutors I have ever met. She can teach many things not mentioned on lecture notes, which is helpful for you to clear concepts. She will also demonstrate and explain about the examples given on lecture notes (which unfortunately lacked explanation)

After lessons, students could still approach her easily. You can even find her after lesson times to ask about this course's materials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme is as follows:
Quiz at beginning of semester: 5%
Regular lab practice every week: 10%
Programming assignments * 3: 24% (6+8+10)
Midterm: 25%
Final Exam: 36%


Quiz: Full Mark 25, Mean 20.00, SD 2.91.

Lab: Basically everyone got full marks.

PA: Most people got 80 or above for the 3 assignments. The guidelines were not given explicitly, but as long as you follow the requirements strictly, you should be able to get fair marks for the 3 assignments.

Midterm: Mean 60.1, SD 18.5. 4 past papers from recent years will be given on the course site, which can allow you to preview what to expect in the exam. The exam was not too difficult, and people could get up to 99/100 marks in this semester.

Final: Mean 55.4, SD 22.0. Similar to midterms, you can get 4 past papers from recent years too. You were given 3 hours to complete 11 questions (first question consist of 10 T/F parts), and questions related to pointers / linked lists were fairly difficult.



The grading was quite fair I think. I got 92.5% (above 1.8 SD in midterm, 1.7 SD in final) in total and resulted in A+; people claimed that getting above mean can already give you a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is quite large, even for a 4 credit course. There are 3 PAs, 11 labs, midterm and final exam for this course.

For the first 3-4 labs, you only have to spend around 30 minutes each, but for the later labs, you may end up spending above 1 day to complete the lab, which was a waste of time. However, as the coding for the labs would not be checked, many people ended up copying others' code for the regular labs.

For the 3 PAs, the difficulty grew exponentially - the first PA was fairly easy and could be finished in 2 hours, while the 3rd PA took me more than 3 days to finish.

You had to go through all lecture notes thoroughly for the midterm and final exam.

reviews.author: CS
reviews.comment_content: The Lecture Notes is well organised. Also, It provides a new C++ features like lamda. The  content is no different compares with the previous lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian Mak is a good teacher.He is a well prepared for the course. He also speaks a good English and explain the idea clearly. He uses the IPad and Apple Pencil during the class. I think it is his teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading: Actually, this is not a good grade course. the instructor follows the school grading reference. That means getting an A range is very difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: There are eleven labs , three project assignments, one midterm and one final exam. Workload depends on your sense of programming. The recursion task is difficult and consuming a lot of time. As a 4 credits course. the workload is quite heavy.

reviews.author: Xelopie
reviews.comment_content: It's easy if you have learned C/C++ before. It's about C++ for beginners. Just some basic stuff like pointers, if, while loop, etc. The lab work is not so hard as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think Andrew is a great instructor. He is good at explaining the ideas of different lines. He was also humorous so that we were always given some funny videos to enjoy at the end of the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: On average, I think it is not good in grading. You need to reach almost 80% in order to get a B+/B (the mean is usually around 70%) If you get a final score around the mean, you probably will only get C+.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 assignments and 10 labs in 1 semester. The first 2 assignments nearly spent me half day for each of them. The final one took me 1 whole day to figure it out and also debug. The lab work was much more easier. If you have enough experience, you can figure it out very fast. So generally speaking, not so much to do in this course.

reviews.author: David Mak
reviews.comment_content:
This course assumes that students have already taken any of the COMP1000 prerequisite courses, and gives students a week to bridge the gap between Python/Java/Excel VBA before starting with C++.

The course will cover aspects of the C++ programming language from basic conditional logic to pointers and classes. Lecture notes are often very comprehensive and additional material will be distributed to aid students.

Alternate Course Title: Introduction to C++ Programming Language
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Chan is very concise when explaining concepts in general, and she will spend extra time and effort on relatively more difficult concepts (e.g. pointers). She will also spend time after class to try answer questions from students.

The Lab TAs are also very kind and helpful. They will try to explain the goal and approach to the assignments concisely.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Quiz
10% Lab Exercise
24% Homework assignment
25% Midterm
36% Final

You must not miss the 10% from lab exercises. Missing one session could be the difference of half a grade. (I learned this the hard way)

Homework assignment is also score high, as there will be some test cases already provided.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload throughout the semester is fairly average, and there is generally no prior reading before class. However, students are expected to be very familiar with the concepts in the exams, and thus workload will exponentially increase during examination periods.

You may consider workload as 'B' if you are a highly motivated individual, or you have prior experience in programming.

reviews.author: yo~~~~~
reviews.title: great teaching team
reviews.comment_content:
Generally, the content is easy to understand. If you have taken COMP 1022P, it will be much easier for you to understand this.
It gives you some basic knowledge about C++. More importantly, you may begin to think like a programmer after some training.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cecia is a great teacher.
She gives us some candy in the last lecture~-~
And TAs are also impressive. They are patient to deal with your problem in the lab.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite fair.
Assignment 15%
Lab 25%
Midterm 25%
Final 35%
I got a full grade in assignments and labs, 91/100 in the midterm ,85/100 in final.
An A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is not heavy. But you need to pay enough time to make sure you understand the material and your assignments can run well.

reviews.author: butter New fly
reviews.title: Better grade than expected
reviews.comment_content: The content covers basics in C++ with very little Object-oriented programming. Before midterm, there's no much new things than the basic comp introduction course. After midterm, the most difficult part is pointer, however, if you clearly understand every example in the lecture notes, there will be no big problem.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cecia is excellent instructor, and the lectures are not boring. She explains content and examples very clearly, in a way that suits my way of learning very well. She is also very friendly to questions both after class and by email. After midterm, she also provided lecture videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is much better than expected. I think final exam will somehow decide the most of the grade, because the exam is not easy and the content is overwhelming.
quiz                        5%
lab exercises         10%
homework assignments^  24%
midterm exam        25%
final exam              36%

For quiz, Mean = 22.02; SD = 2.53, me 22.
For midterm, Mean = 72.85; SD = 18.22, me 90.
For final, Mean = 63.35; SD = 23.38, me 84.
And got an A finally.
reviews.comment_workload: There's one lab per week, 10 in total. The first 5 or 6 is very easy, and last few need some time to think over and debug. I think doing lab in advance and by yourself is most important, do not think of discussing with others or seek help from others while debugging, because there's no one to help in final exam.  And assignment 3 is challenging, it took one weekend and a weekday to debug, but the work is worthwhile. Do not give up!

reviews.comment_teaching: Andrew is a good teacher ever, he always spend few minutes to play a video, or show something which is very interesting. I like his teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading:

quiz 5%
lab exercises 10%
homework assignments(3 assignments: 7+7+10)   24%
midterm exam 25%
final exam 36%
TOTAL 100%
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a lot, 10 labs + 3 assignments, it cause me a lot of time to do.

reviews.author: Benker

before midterm it is about basic programming language, if you take comp 1022P java, it is quite easy to follow the content before midterm since C/C++ is similar to java

After midterm is not easy I think, difficult part is the pointer and data types.
reviews.comment_teaching: not interesting but acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading: not good maybe
reviews.comment_workload: very heavy, one lab for a week, starting from lab 3 or 4, it is difficult, and it is not like the comp 1000 level labs, sometimes it is difficult for me to finish the whole function myself.

reviews.author: Keithlo8813
reviews.comment_content:
C++ syntax, looping, recursion, array, pointer, ...
It seems like teaching you C++ instead of OOP, it only have one lecture note is about OOP. Before the midterm, the content is petty easy to follow. But after midterm, it requires more time to understand the content, especially pointer and array.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer is passionate, but a bit boring.
She usually explains stuff in her own way, it is difficult to judge whether it is a good way or not, but for me, I don't enjoy that way.
reviews.comment_grading: Acceptable. Below mean within one SD for midterm and final. All Assignments are around  9X. I finally got C+. For final, I think it is not enough time for student to complete all the questions. It suddenly changed the pattern of the paper compared with the previous paper.
reviews.comment_workload:
Three assignments.
One quiz.
One midterm
One Final exam.
Lab every week except first two weeks.
I think the workload is heavy, after all, it is a 4 credit course. The lab and assignments are all time consuming.

reviews.author: Wind
reviews.comment_content:
If you have learn programming in you high school, you will find that the content of the course isn't really useful. This course covers a lot of basic content of programming. And if you have learn C++, it will be more useless for learning.

Quiz (3 in class quiz and 3 MC-questions each quiz
The first is a trail and hence not include in the final score. The remaining two are easy and because they are done on computer, you can check you answer before choosing.
1 closed book short quiz
This quiz is testing some self-learning content such as basic control and flow)
Assignment (total number of 3
The first two are easy and you can easily get full mark if you have read all the instruction provide in course webpage. However, the third will focus on data structure and it is quite difficult to get full mark)
Lab (Every week you need to attend because it take attendance. The program you need to complete isn't easy and if you have not prepared the lab, you have a high chance failing to complete the work in time and you can only get the attended mark.)
reviews.comment_teaching: Because this may be the first real programming course that most of the student may attend in HKUST, Cecia teaches everything in a really detail and slow way. However, as I said before, if you have some basic background for programming, you will find yourself difficult to focus on the lecture. Also, the TAs in the lab are really helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't really know the how the grading system work but i will provide some data.
I have attended all the lab and finish all the tasks. I got 25/30 in quiz and scored full mark in the first two assignments while the mean are 90.5 and 94.7. I got 82.5 in the third assignment and the mean is 80.2. For the midterm, 83.5 and the mean is 65.8. And final is 62 while the mean is 42.2.
And my final grade is B+.
In my view, getting a A-range isn't easy. However, if you are aiming B-range, I think it's quite easy if you have complete all the assignments and attend all the lab.
reviews.comment_workload: There are only three assignments and you will have nearly two weeks to complete for each assignments. The first two are so easy and I just use less than one hours to finish it. However, the third one is much difficult and it takes me more than 10 hours to do. But still, I can't get the full mark.

reviews.author: Adi
reviews.title: Great teacher, extremely hard course
reviews.comment_content: Covers a range of programming content in C++ ranging from the basics all the way up to pointers. Very hands-on, with weekly labs and practical assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Mak was really good, he made everything as understandable as possible and would take time to answer questions if you missed out on anything. The TAs were generally pretty great too and seemed to care about helping out.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is done fairly in my opinion - for the assignments and labs you get points based on how much of your program actually works and can fulfill the requirements that they set out, which makes sense and encourages you to actually get results. I also liked how they allowed and encouraged multiple solutions for everything - as long as it works, it works.
reviews.comment_workload:
Should be noted that I'm a business student without a programming background other than the intro course, but I found COMP2011 really tough. I would say that I studied hardest for this course compared to all my other courses in that semester, and still had to fight just to pass the course.

It's a great course and it teaches you a tonne, just make sure if you take it you have a plan to use the knowledge you get from it and are dedicated.

reviews.author: Dranithix
reviews.comment_content: Extremely abundant amount of content in regards to the basics and principals of efficient programming and memory management for a low-level object-oriented language like C++.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture notes were extremely well written and a lot of previous past papers were provided alongside TA's who were willing to help out and are knowledgeable in programming.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is somewhat harsh in correspondence to the workload given that many people have already been familiar with programming before the start of the course.

Be extremely aware of the curve and always ensure you atleast get 1.5SD + Mean if you wish for a high-A range grade. Don't slack off during finals or your midterm, they're extremely important when it comes towards determining your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: As other students have had previous experiences in programming, expect the majority of your time either attempting to know their level and more. It is to be expected especially since the class was intended for people with computer science-oriented degrees, so definitely expect a heavy workload.

reviews.author: hildaaaaa
reviews.title: practice is really important
reviews.comment_content:
The content is indeed useful in programming. It could give a good basic knowledge to you for further learning in programming.

2011 course only includes the C language and the C++ language would be taught in 2012.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian's lesson is somehow boring. I often fall asleep in the second half of the lesson. However, if you are really interested in the course and interested in programming, you would find his lesson useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
In 201516 fall semester, it was not good grading. Because I have failed in this course in fall sem, I retake this course in the spring semester and i found many people familiar to me. I get a C in the second semester i studied the course.

It very rely on who is the TA than who is instructor. A good TAs could give you easier labs and easier assignments so that students may learn more efficiently.
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week has a lab. In the last few labs, many students just come and sign up and left. The labs attendance are 1 of 2 marks. If you perfectly finish the lab, you would get another 1 mark.

For Homework, there are not much assignments. The assignments are about once in every month. It requires students to write a program with hints.

reviews.author: Fat Ho
reviews.comment_content: All about C++, all sorts of text content without anything related to graphics inserting, even games made in this course are in text-style, quite boring and unsatisfactory
reviews.comment_teaching: CHAN, Ki Cecia teaches quite well but her lectures are quite boring
reviews.comment_grading: Not really good, the content is really hard and challenging but the mean score is very high, so it is not a good grading course
reviews.comment_workload: 3 assignments, 10> labs, midterm and finals, labs and assignment have really high workload because some of them are extremely hard, and lab if the students are not preparing the lab before the real lab session, I think around 90% of people may not be able to finish it in the 2-hour session and they may finally fail to obtain the content mark (1 out of 2)

reviews.author: IT Hund
reviews.title: No pain No gain
reviews.comment_content: Actually is not officially an OOP course, it should be called introduction to c++, the contents are about basic c++ syntax e.g. looping and conditional statements, recursion, pointer and reference, and a few data structures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
very good teaching with clear explanation.
all professors were also teaching in detail.
if you missed the class, you can watch the lecture video by clicking into the course webpage.
reviews.comment_grading: follow the standard of ust grading system, which means if you score in mean, you are likely to get b-/c+/c. if you wanna get A range, above 1.5/2 sd is needed.
reviews.comment_workload: labs and assignments were challenging, even you had have a quite solid background in c++.

reviews.comment_content:
midterm前：用c++ language去做loop(while, for), if, variable, array, recursion, 同comp1021/1022p/1022q 內容差唔多，只係用另一種programming language
midterm 後：Struct, pointers, class, stack and queue, 算係比較新既野，但concept都易明。

btw comp需要多d practise而唔係睇書，對住本書不如對住部電腦.

我唯一既programming background只係comp102x，最後都有A。
reviews.comment_teaching: 冇上堂，臨交assignment/考試前睇lecture video 都ok. 不過最好定前追下。
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading...
lab exercises 10%
homework assignments 25%
midterm exam 25%
final exam 40%
每星期一個lab exercise, 開頭幾次即堂做都做得完，但後面既lab需要用好多時間做，務必在lab之前開始睇下做下，否則做唔完就得1/2 或1.5/2分。

reviews.comment_workload: assignment要預留多幾日黎做同debug，一日冇可能做得完。然後lab都盡早做，以免做唔切。其實都係當定期逼自己溫下書，反正做過lab同assignment 考試唔溫／hea溫都冇事，workload可以接受。只能說No pain no gain!

reviews.author: abhr
reviews.comment_content: Content itself covers the C++ basics and all other basic concepts covered by any programming course, plus topics like pointers, classes, stack+queue that might strike out as slightly different than what is learnt in the COMP introductory courses in UST. Topics themselves are interesting. Content after the midterm is the challenging part.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Sander covers topics well. The lecture videos were provided as well that were helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Harsh grading. Hardly anything in the course material prepares you for the final or the assignments (last two). Midterm is doable, but the final in incomparable to the past papers, tough and really lengthy. Basically, course concepts are twisted in the weirdest ways possible. The last two assignments we received were nerve-wracking, took days to complete, yet were hard to score in. Basically, all were plots to bring your grade down. Lol. Don't take the course if you don't really need to. Not content with the course after all the effort.
reviews.comment_workload: The course content is light, but the assignments, being really hard, takes days to complete, halting everything else and any other plans you might have for other courses. Not much work to be done for the final or midterm, although the final is an awaited storm.  Labs take time to do beforehand.

reviews.author: JustinIsVerySex
reviews.title: Apparently this is a "hard" course.
reviews.comment_content: If you barely had to study for COMP 1021 you would have little to no issue with the content. It is really intuitive and easy to follow for the first half of the semester. It takes a tad bit more effort in the later chapters but it is nothing to sweat about. Most of the things you can just understand from a glance and only requires a bit of thinking to implement. Among all the courses I studied this semester this one requires the least effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cecia Chan is energetic when she teaches and gives clear examples when explaining new concepts. At the start of each lesson, quizzes the class on what they learnt last time to make sure they remember. Nothing really much to criticize.
reviews.comment_grading:
Consistency is key with this course with roughly 30% of the grade being assignments and weekly labs. The exam questions are only a little tough but your real enemy is time. You have to balance writing your code flawlessly vs writing your code quickly.


The only truly annoying thing is you have to write your code on paper, which is really dumb, because it is easy to make syntax mistake and hard to rewrite code once you found a problem. You have to really, really think clearly about your code before you write it down, or otherwise there is not enough space.
reviews.comment_workload:
The weekly labs are not difficult, only requiring you to have fundamental knowledge to understand how to do. For earlier labs you can finished them in >= 30 minutes, and at most, when lab content is about pointers, they can take 3 hours at most, 1 if you are smart about it.

The assignments on the other hand have many little tasks that require more thinking. There are only 3 in the whole semester, but you put in ~ 3 days for the last one. If you want to get full assignment points, make sure to allocate time because the final assignment is close to finals, where you might have a ton of other stuff to do.

reviews.author: Surya

The content is pretty easy to grasp but the exam will test more tricky and rigorous details of the easy topics.

reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is OK, not too bad. Slightly below the mean got a C+.
3 Assignments (PA1, PA2, PA3)
10 Labs
1 Quiz (something like a midterm)
1 Final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite heavy. Almost every week there's a lab (kind of daunting if it's your first programming class after COMP1021). The first few labs are easy and didn't even take an hour but the complexity and time requirement increases quickly throughout the course.
     There were 3 major programming assignments. Not as light and quick as labs. Require about 1.5 to 2 weeks to finish if the workload is divided properly over those weeks.
     The final and "midterm" quiz was online on Canvas because of the online semester due to covid in spring 2022. The biggest issue for most people was time limitation.

Pointer
C++ Class

Self- studied:
File I/O
Separate Compilation
C++ String

You can easily understand some of them after having COMP 1021. But the labs, PAs and tests are a lot more trickier than COMP 1021.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching, but in a slow pace (in my opinion).
reviews.comment_grading:
Haven't finish the course.
But from the marks given for the labs, PAs and mid-term, just normal marking. The mid-term is harder than expected.

lab exercises 10%
programming assignments(PA) 24% (8%, 8%, 8%)

final exam 40%

For lab exercise, it is very easy

For the PA, they will give you some test data but even you pass all the test data on zinc, it doesn't meant that you have done it all correctly.

For the midterm and final one advise is try to write some codes that a normal human won't write it. For example doing addition with booleans.

This course is highly competitive, so the grading is not good (personal feeling)
reviews.comment_workload: Personally I think the workload is light. Only 1 very easy lab nearly every week. All the PA will have at least 2 weeks to do. Totally enough time to do it.

reviews.comment_workload:
3 Assignment

reviews.author: Miracles
reviews.title: Truely hope that you don't need to take the exam on Canvas
reviews.comment_content:
C++ stuffs
Not that difficult to students who had program before.
For those who never program before, you better focus on every boring lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Profs:
I saw that he really love and will to pay effort in teaching. There are many strange questions in the chatroom and he give us clear explanations to all the questions. However, teaching programming stuffs must be boring. Do not expect that you will have so much fun in the lecture.

Tutor:
I was taught by Wallace for the tutorials. Most of the time in the tutorials will be used to check your homework. But there will be around 10 mins teaching session before checking. For the teaching part, he always put some meme in his powerpoint and make the tutorial less boring. For the checking part, I had made a mistake in my program once. He can point it out and let me understand what's is wrong in a short period of time. So, I think his teaching skill is quite good too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not yet release.

Marks gain from:
1.Exam
2.Assignment
3.Tutorial
4.Quiz

For 2 and 3, it is not difficult to get all the marks.
For 4, it's a normal quiz.

For 1, it's a disaster to us.
In this semester, we take the exam on Canvas. The profs says that it should be more easier as we can type using keyboard. BUT, it just a joke.

For the short question, we just need to read the code and write the output. It's ok if it's not some long code.

For the long question, it's insane. The question is like a long eassy pasted on the Canvas. The question is listed at the top and the answer box is listed at the bottom. You will need to scroll downward  at least 2 - 3 times (using your mouse wheel) to reach the answer box. The question ask you to fill your answer in the blank. But, actually you need to copy the whole things from the question to your answer box. However, the question is not a text that you can copy, but an image. So, you need to scroll up 3 times, remember it, scroll down 3 times, write it, fill in your answer, scroll up 3 times, check it again, scroll down 3 times, check it again. Then you finish the part a) (i). That mean you need to repeat it for many many many time to answer a single long question.

It seems that it is not my personal problem as the mean is really low even though the question is not that difficult.

For the Exam, the mean is 39.8.
For the Assignments, the mean is always around 8x% while there are always >200 students in my lecture group get full marks.

So, I truely hope that you don't need to take the exam on Canvas.
reviews.comment_workload:
You will need to do your homework every week. If you are good at programming, you may only need about 2 - 3 hours to finish it. Otherwise, you may need to spend a whole day to complete it.

It's quite a suffer because the profs will release a new homework after you finished checking the current homework.

Unlimited HomeWork.

reviews.title: A course which you need to work hard
reviews.comment_content: The main content of COMP 2011 is about the usage of C++. It is intended for students with basic programming background (such as the programming concepts in COMP 1021/1022P/1022Q). It will be an introduction to C++ object-oriented programming and data structures such as stacks, queues, linked lists, and binary trees. When you finish the learning of COMP 2011, you should have a basic backgroud of programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer of COMP 2011 is average. The teaching is clear but a little boring. And the learning experience in COMP 1022P is very useful. Some points would be skipped as it is assumed that you have the programming basis of java.
reviews.comment_grading: Because of the socail influence during the 19-20 fall semester, I chose the passing grading. So there is no experience of the grading.

The midterm is hard and checking paper is very important. Because of the socail influence during the 19-20 fall semester, the final exam is turned into assignment 4. So there is no experience of final exam.

reviews.author: etyt
reviews.comment_content: The following topics are taught: basic, control, array, recursion, structure, function, cpp-11 features, scope, separate-compilation, file input & output, string, pointer, class, stack and queue. Although some of them were not included in the exam, still they are all very useful. For me, things go crazy when using pointer because it is a rather complicated thing and when deleting all pointers using a loop, you have to be very careful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cecia is a very nice lecturer. She is willing to answer every students' question. In the lessons, the content was quite well explained, with sufficient examples and sample programmes.
Meanwhile, most of the students in the class didn't attend the lectures after the midterm, as all the lectures were recorded.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade distribution (normal):
Quiz (in mid-September): 5%
Lab (10 sessions, not counting the mark of the worst two): 10%
Midterm: 25%
Assignment (3, not equally weighted):24%
Exam: 36%

Due to the suspension of teaching, 1 more assignment (10%) was added and the exam was cancelled. So the total score of the course became 74 marks.

I think my grade is reasonable. I performed quite badly in some of the assignments and so the grade is not very good (C+).
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fine. Some students did their labs during the lab session but I prefer doing it before the lesson, so I could immediately show my programme to the TAs and go. But don't worry the labs are easy. The first two assignments were easy and I didn't use much time. The last two were so difficult for me and I even couldn't finish it. To be honest, I shall put more time on practising programming. The difficulty of the midterm was at the right level. Btw, some past papers will be provided on the course website.

reviews.comment_content:
The contents are quite easy at first if you have already know C++ languages before. Even though you only knew C language (like me), you can also handle the course quite well at first. So it is quite recommended to take COMP1029C first if you don't know anything in C++.
But things got much more difficult starting from function overloading and reach the peak at pointers. You really need to practice in order to be familiar and understand the things being taught.
It should be the basic things about programming, so should be useful in the future.
reviews.comment_teaching: She has accent. But that doesn't hinder her teaching. Personally, I think she taught quite well and explain everything very clearly especially when using graphs to teach pointers.

The final exam is above mean about 1. something SD. So at last I could get A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
It really depends in this semester.
We are allowed to form group of two, to create a game in each week from scratch. Bonuses would be given to those with creative ideas and tidy, flexible programming works, and also sometimes special techniques.
If you are going to just finish the lab to get full mark, it should be very easy. But if you are striving for the bonuses, it would take quite some time. I had spent one whole week to finish one of the labs, from planning to implementing to debugging.
Forming group can also depend. It is not more people do better job when coming to programming. Combining codes can be very frustrating as different people have different style of programming. But I think it is a great experience overall.

reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher was horrible. Please do not take this course if only Albert Chung is teaching. If Dit Yan Yeung is teaching, please choose him. Professor Chung speaks in a monotonous tone, and sounds very robotic and is very irritating and displeasing when you hear him.
reviews.comment_grading:

Homework assignments (3 of them) 25%
Midterm and Final exam (both written) 65% combined
reviews.comment_workload: The pre-requisite for this course is a basic 1000-level COMP course. Once you are done with those courses, you have a certain level of liking for programming, and a certain expectation regarding the way programming works, and regarding the amount of effort you require in it. But boom, as soon as you take this course, you realize what real programming is, and how much effort it is. There is a lot of effort, and avoid taking this course if you have a lot of credits for the semester. The syllabus till before the midterm is basically just recursion and loops. However, after midterm, we are introduced to arrays, pointers, classes and objects, stacks and queues, linked lists etc.

另外有d TA 改卷好hea，output 肯定一樣，但個flow 唔同左樣少少佢都有機會當你錯 (成題無分)，所以一定要去 check 卷。
reviews.comment_grading:

MT 94/100
Final 119.5/?
最後 A+
reviews.comment_workload: 有3份 PA，workload 算中上，不過話哂都係 4 crd course

reviews.author: PakNin
reviews.title: Not a very difficult course
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers C++ from basics to detailed OOP. The first half of the course is easy, just simple indentation and logical thinking(if else, while, switch), which are similar to COMP1021. The second half of the course started to be a bit challenging, which covers pointers, class and stacks. They would be the boss in final exam.
Here are the content list.
1 Introduction
1-2 C++ Basics
1-2 Control Flow
1-2 Problems for Basics and Control
3-4 Function I
5 Array
6 Function II: Recursion  
6 Scope
7 Struct
7-8 Function III: Miscellaneous  
9-11 Pointer
11-12 C++ Class
13 Stack & Queue
and some self-study topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cecia is good at teaching, her English is easy to understand, and various detailed example programs are provided.
The arrangement of lab sessions was not ideal. Some students have to sit in the Zoom lesson and wait for about an hour so as to answer Q&A from TAs
For me, I am quite familiar with C++ so I skipped most of the lessons after the first few weeks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme is a bit different from 1021, which not only require your marks to be greater than a constant, but with this formula,
(total score >= X) AND ((weighted midterm and final exam scores) >= Y), where X and Y are constants.

Personally I think grading is fair.
Lab:         10/10 (10 Labs, only count highest 8 labs)
PA:           23/24 (3 PA, each 8%)
MidTerm:  24/26
Exam:       32.12/40

Overall:     89.12/100
Grade:      A
reviews.comment_workload:
4 cred course so workload is a bit high. Each week one lab starting from week 1, but students only need to attend every other Zoom lab sessions to answer Q&A(still have to submit lab assignment). The labs were easy, guidelines were provided tho not as detailed as 1021. Mostly can finish in 30-45 mins.

PA is difficult and time-consuming. They were released after midterm exam. They mostly test your understanding of specific topics(e.g. recursion, pointers, class...) but not copying sample programs. Mostly need days to solve it. (Goop is your friend, some nice guys may post hints there)

reviews.author: AHZHONG
reviews.comment_content:
Many topics are not too difficult. In my opinion, recursion and pointer are the most difficult topics. You have to write more code in order to train your brain to think recursively. Also, to understand pointers, it would be best if you tried to understand the concepts such as memory.
Week 1: Introduction
Week 1 - 2: C++ Basics

reviews.author: ltxtftrsn
reviews.comment_content:
A piece of cake for anyone who has any background in programming, medium but fair for any newbies to C++, good luck to those who struggle even in COMP 1021.
Generally, just the basics of C++, and can practically be self-taught if you are bright enough.
reviews.comment_teaching: Emm... Self-taught. Didn't go to classes. Oops.
reviews.comment_grading: Again, easy A's for those with any programming background, and fair grades to those who first learned C++ in this course (as I have heard from my friends).
reviews.comment_workload: Medium. Lab sessions almost every week and three assignments across the entire term for testing one's knowledge from the previous classes. Not exactly unproblematic, some labs and assignments do best if you have prior knowledge to the projects (games iirc), but still won't do badly for anyone who doesn't.

reviews.author: yhy
reviews.title: ZINC SUCKS
reviews.comment_content: It is not so difficult for students who have programming experience. Although it may appear to be challenging appraoching the end of the course for students who have no prior knowledge in c++ and oop, i am sure you can manage to overcome it if you put effort in it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cindy is a very good teacher and she explains abstract concepts very well. You can easily stay above mean if you attend every lecture and spend 1 or 2 days revising.
reviews.comment_grading: the assignments are so damn difficult and time cosuming. The automatic grading system ZINC sucks. It can crush a hundred times, so you better start early.
reviews.comment_workload: lab every week, 3 pa. The pa can be very very very challenging. And ZINC make the work load 10 times larger.

reviews.author: jccy2106
reviews.comment_content:
List of Topics
1. Introduction to computer programming
2. C++ basics: basic syntax, data types, operators
3. Control flow
4. Functions
5. Array and structure
6. Recursion
7. Scope
8. Struct
9. Pointers
10. Dynamic Data
11. Class
12. Stack and Queue

Self Study Topic:
Separate Compilation
File input/output
reviews.comment_teaching: Cindy Li is a good lecturer. She is patient at explaining the topics and answering questions. There are no tutorials in this course. Labs are only for demoing your lab work so no teaching is involved there. Piazza is very useful for asking questions and getting answers from students and instructors as well.
reviews.comment_grading: Very difficult final.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly labs. 3 Assignments. 1 Quiz. 1 Final exam. Overall I think the workload is moderate. Labs are fairly easy. Assignments can be quite difficult especially the one about recursion.

reviews.author: ctliaj
reviews.comment_content:
In general
Basics: if statement/ for loop/ while loop, scope/ datatypes/ struct/ OOP
Concept: Recursion, Pointer, implementation of data structures (linked list, stack, queue, and Binary tree)

The harder topic in the course is Pointer, which took a big part in my final exam. For those who want to prepare in advance, I recommend starting with Pointer.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It was surprising that she was able to go through all the lecture materials so much in-depth and demonstrate all the programs given on the course website multiple times only in a period of three months. Some say she'd explain the fundamental even the trivial concepts too much in detail thus making the course boring.

Other than that, there is nothing wrong with the way she teaches. It was quite helpful and concise actually, even for students with no prior programming experience.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab exercises (10%) 10/10, once every week

3 programming assignments (10%, 12%, 15%)
pa1 74/100 (Manipulating elements in an array),
mean 88/100
Comment: Not hard at all. The -36 marks was me forgetting to delete a line of printout.

pa2 100/100 (Finding the longest path with recursion)
mean 71
Comment: Hardest of all. Regardless, the majority got 100/100.

pa3 100/100 (Doubly linked list represented by a train)
mean 84
Comment: Easier than pa2. Very straightforward.

Quiz (10%) 31/35. Include only the basics written above up to the topic of Datatypes. The hardest part for me was to trace the program.

Final exam (43%) 56.5/100. Most questions were about OOP with pointers. It was mostly about solving problems rather than just coding. One of mine was a question from Leetcode. Nevertheless, doing every past paper on the course website and reading the exam questions carefully should be sufficient for getting >70%.

Overall ~77/100 B+

People with overall ~mean get B. The cut-off is probably at 80% like most of the other comp courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
One assignment per month. Although each can be done in probably less than a week.

Ten labs in total, a couple of hours should be enough.

I think the workload is pretty light!

reviews.author: CCC_ccc
reviews.comment_content: basic (but complicated) things about c++
reviews.comment_teaching: not bad, at least the slides are really good as review material.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading was reasonable. I got quiz: 32/35, lab: 8/10, pa1: 86/100, pa2: 97/100, pa3: 97/100, and final around 10 points above mean, and finally it's a B+
reviews.comment_workload: 這門課就是給大家建立coding基礎的，想要基礎打好當然workload 不小, lab每周都有，不用花太多時間，但pa很花時間和腦力，如果不是非常聰明最好有朋友可以一起討論，否則可能幾天沒得睡覺還拿不到分數

reviews.author: I Love Flutter
reviews.title: Say No To Plagiarism and Do Some LeetCode (https://leetcode.com/)
reviews.comment_content:
I will talk about my background first. I am an associate student who already have C++ background (without pointer) and Data Structure in Java. That's why the course was pretty easy for me.
You can check the content from others feedback which is very common teaching scope of any fundamental programming course in any universities.

I kinda fucked up my online MC quiz because I thought we could only compile the code with human brain (not with paper) and go back to previous questions (the canvas system didn't allow students to go back to previous submitted questions). So, I just finished the test within 30 mins out of 45 and waited there for freaking 15 mins rethinking my mistakes. Fuck man. While I was waiting there I looked up the Zoom Camera and others students were all doing the compilation on the paper.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Li is a very good teacher. Helpful and willing to explain the details in deep. Although many students complained about her accent, I think it wasn't a big deal as I found it easy to understand what she taught and many foreign students do agree. Students should really train themselves to listen to people with accent. Those Indians, Russians and Chinese online videos on YouTube will be extremely useful in your later career if you want to do self-learning or watch extra content of your courses. And their accent problem are like 20x more serious than Dr. Li. Think about it. ;)
The whole teaching team especially Wallace and other 3 TA who designed the PAs were willing to spend their time responding our stupid questions and jokes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz - C++ syntax, error finding, looping compilation
------------------------------------------------------------------
PA1 - Array and Function (Leetcode Question ==)
***Update (1/30): I think the question is the same as Leetcode Daily Challenge 30/1 Rotate Array
Link: https://leetcode.com/problems/rotate-array/
------------------------------------------------------------------
PA2 - Recursion and Function (Pretty hard if you are not familiar with recursion)
------------------------------------------------------------------
PA3 - Double Linked List and Pointer
------------------------------------------------------------------
Final - It gotta be damn long:
1) Error findings
2) Code Compilation on Recursive functions
3) Tree Drawing, Code Compilation on Recursive functions
4) Pointers & Dynamic Array - deference of deference, Pointer of Array? I forgot the details of this question.
5) Recursion on Linked List
    a) https://leetcode.com/problems/add-two-numbers/
    b) https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-linked-list/ (USE RECURION)
    c) Forgot
6) Class and methods
------------------------------------------------------------------
Quiz: 26/35
PA1: 0/100 (Originally 98/100, GitHub Issue, you know if you know)
PA2: 48.9/100 (4 deadline crashed together so I gave up 2 main tasks)
PA3: 92.8/100
Lab: 10/10
Final: 60.5/100 (It is a easy one I think, I didn't do revision on the Pointer of Pointer questions and others mistakes were all the simplest question :| )
--------------------------------------------
Final Grade is C+. I think it is reasonable as I have already lost 10% + 6% in PA1 and PA2 respectively.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of this course is acceptable but PA2 was a bit hard this year for students without legit programming background. Don't get hyped if you get an A in the stupid Python course which teach about Panda. Many students get A range in elementary Python course fucked up in COMP2011 and COMP2012h.

As mentioned in CONTENT section, I am an associate students so my study pattern is different form most of the CS students. I studied this course and Computer Organization in the same semester yet, this is not a good decision at all. The homework deadline of these 2 courses overlapped all the time with other deadline of stupid LANG courses. So, COMP2011 is a good course to take if your deadlines don't collide together. Otherwise, it might be a nightmare for you guys.

reviews.author: chaer
reviews.title: Do not choose his lectures！
reviews.comment_content: Since someone else had already posted the course content，I will not post it here. A brief review on basics and control for 3 weeks then moving on. Remember to focus on pointer, which is difficult but really important for no programming background student.
reviews.comment_teaching: This professor has a verrrrrry strong accent. You need to distract much attention on figuring out what he is trying to express although he actually teaches programming with lot of examples. Gary’s lecture is a better choice.
reviews.comment_grading:
I received a grade of C+
Final exam needed full preparation.

labs just so so

reviews.author: urwlcmt
reviews.title: Great Teaching, Challenging yer Manageable Workload
reviews.comment_content: Covers the basics of C++, i.e. data types, syntax, logic, flow control, array, function, struct, pointer and some introductory OOP concepts. Later topics may be quite challenging for students with few programming background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teaching from lecturer: clear explanations, good pace, and timely help if needed.
TA could have been better,
reviews.comment_grading: Will get all marks in assignments and labs if you do everything you're asked to, which are manageable with enough time and effort.
reviews.comment_workload: Three assignments throughout the semester; later ones were relatively challenging, but not impossible if you spend enough time. Exam is quite challenging, require quick thinking.

reviews.author: below_mean_guy
reviews.comment_content:
Main topics are:

- Basics and Controls
- Functions
- Arrays
- Recursion
- Scope
- Struct
- Separate Compilation
- Pointer
- Class
- Stack & Queue

The basics and controls (which are similar to those covered in the prerequisite courses) are covered in the first two weeks.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is adequate to medium level students. Cecia teaches quite slow and explains everything very clearly.

Besides, my lab TA (Wallace) is very good. His teaching has some fun in it and he can answer your question very quickly and clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair.

The grading scheme is as follows:
Lab - 10%
Assignments - 36% (10+12+14)
Quiz - 8%
Final - 46%

If you aim for a pass, you have to get a separate pass in exams and assignments (the passing mark fluctuates, but guaranteed to be not more than 50% of lab + assignments and not more than 30% of quiz + final)

Stats for this sem (according to Canvas):
Labs: 9.XX/10
Assignments: 82.2%,78.8%,82.1%
Quiz: 18.6/24
Final: 39.8/100
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite high, but it is suitable for a 4-credit course.

The assignments can take you a lot of time as they are somehow very challenging.

Some labs are easy, but some can also take you some time. You have to try the labs before your lab session.

reviews.comment_content: The most important and difficult content about this course was about how pointers works in cpp. cpp is quite similar to java in many ways, so if you took Comp1022P, you would have edge to the others. reviews.author: mmm
reviews.title: very difficult, heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: Teach you C++
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually, the prof teaches quite good. But the content is too difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: bad because it is very difficult
reviews.comment_workload: lab is very difficult, especially for the later ones. The tutor advises us to complete the task before coming to the lab. Therefore, it is very time-consuming. Sometimes, it is too hard that u may only get 1 mark out of 2 because of your attendance. 1 is deducted for not completing the task.  There are 3 assignments in total. The first 2 are acceptable in terms of difficulty and time needed. The last one is extremely difficult that u may just want to give up. Lastly, the mid term and exam are both very difficult.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.title: lol
reviews.comment_content: C++ basics. Really just memorizing syntax and errors if you don't already know it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Never went to a single class, so I wouldn't know. Spent 10 minutes at each lab just to get my lab problem sets checked.
reviews.comment_grading:
Didn't study at all, never went to lectures, read the slides once. Did all the labs and assignments. Got a B.

As long as you do all the labs and homework, you should easily get a B or above.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low workload. Labs take no time at all, and assignments take between 10 minutes and 2 hours.

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.title: Good Course, Bad Professor
reviews.comment_content: Fundamentals of C++ programming. Including loops,logics, recursion, pointers, lists, classes etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor basically is just reading the words in the PowerPoint slides. Attending lectures is meaningless as long as yo got the notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Exams are difficult but the mean score is still really high. Grades are unknown as it is not given yet.
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely high. You got 1 lab work to do each week that can't be finished in one lab session. That means you have to do it before hand. Besides, you also got 3 extremely time consuming difficult assignments to do in the semester. Better do it as early as possible so that you could have time to ask help if needed.

reviews.author: Ahhim
reviews.title: Need to work hard on self study
reviews.comment_content: Include basic of C++. From simple things like For-loop, while-loop to the later harder topics like recursion and pointers. Pointers are really complicated and confusing in my opinion so better work harder on that before it is too late.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructors and TAs are quite nice. The lectures are not boring and the professor always explains with examples, which is easier to understand imo.
reviews.comment_grading:
reasonable grading. 8 Labs and 3 assignments all came with which specific tasks you failed so you can appeal if you think there is any mistakes

The Labs and homework are not that hard to do and you can always find TA for help if you do not know how you do. Just remember they are the easy source for scores.

Midterms and Finals are rather difficult compare to them. Since it requires you to write code by hand, I think time limit is quite a concern.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I mentioned in the previous part, there are 8 labs and 3 homework. The labs are all quite simple and will not take too much of  your time to finish them, even if you are not familiar with the topics. The assignments on the other hand are quite time-consuming as it consists of numerous of complex tasks.

You usually have either a homework or lab per week.

reviews.author: SamuelLee
reviews.title: As a guy with a C+ in the pre-req, it feels so good when you walk through such a tough course with God.
reviews.comment_content:
C++ Basics
Control Flow
Function
Array
String
File I/O
(From here, it gets harder SIGNIFICANTLY)
Recursion
Scope
Separate Compilation
Struct
Pointer
C++ Class
Stack & Queue
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cindy explains the concepts quite clearly, as she uses an iPad to draw the logic out on the share screen for us to understand. However her accent may be confusing at times.
Most of my lab demos are handled by Vivian, but I have attended the office hours of various TAs when I am stuck in labs and PAs. They are really supportive and give a lot of helpful tips. I still remember one TA telling me about the idea of deep/shallow copy. The skills were quite useful, especially for students with very little programming background like me. I feel that the numerous office hours available to us really prepared us for harder applications, so you should go there if you got stuck as this is what they prepared for you.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% labs (my score: 29.5/30, mean: 24.7/30)
10% quiz (mean: 20.36/35, my score: 22/35)
37% programming assignments (10, 12, 15)
(PA1 mean: 82.2, my score: 88)
(PA2 mean: 82.2, my score: 90)
(PA3 mean: 60.5, my score: 82.9)
43% final exam (mean: 49.7, my score: 59, almost double my score of the comp1021 final exam)
My total score is 73.5/100,  which is a B+, much higher than the C+ I got in 1021. My grade eventually shocked a lot of my friends. Quite unexpected, glory to God!
reviews.comment_workload:
Was really heavy. The labs were still OK, but the PAs were really time consuming. It took me a week to finish PA3, and for both PA2 and PA3 I coded until 2am/3am for at least 1 day.

Try to find some friends to help one another through the difficult PA writing journey, you will feel much better with that. I did that through the comp2011 channel in a discord, as there are a lot of great coursemates. Piazza is also a great platform for you to ask for help.

BTW I actually walked through this comp2011 with God. Without Him, I would have gotten an F. All credit goes to God for my incredible three sub-grade increase, especially when I got stuck on pa2/3. I remembered when I got 90 in the pa2 I shared my joy in front of so many Christians and we all praised God together, and I sang the hymn I Need Thee Every Hour when getting stuck on PA3.

reviews.author: yeahmoee
reviews.title: Pretty well designed course
reviews.comment_content: The content is very well-rounded.  At the start of the course, you will be taught the very basics of C++, then they will move onto more advanced topics such as Pointers and Class. In general, this course is a very good start for CS students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cindy is an awesome lecturer. Her English is good. She gives interesting analogies to difficult ideas. She is also willing to explain to students after the class or in-office hours.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading weight: 10 Labs (only 9 for me due to holiday policy), 3 PAs, 1 Quiz, 1 Final

10 Labs (10 %)
1 Quiz (10 %)
3 PAs (~40 %)
Final (~40 %)

In general, this course's grading is pretty average. Getting an A-range grade is difficult, though it is not impossible. My suggestion is to start doing your PAs as early as possible, they are all very difficult, especially PA2 (recursion) and PA3 (pointers), and when it is around the due date, the submission platform Zinc takes very long to grade. The labs are fairly easy. The Quiz mainly focused on C++ syntax and control flows, and it is easy as well. The final is really, really hard though, it is an overview of what you learned throughout the semester.
reviews.comment_workload: You should expect to spend 1-2 hours for labs, and 8-10 hours for PAs (normally finished in 3-5 days). You should expect to spend at least 5-10 hours a week on the course materials. It is not that bad.

reviews.author: shitMan
reviews.comment_content:
The topics before pointer is basically covered in COMP1022P(java programming), which are quite simple if you took 1022p seriously.

The rest of the topics: pointer, linked list, binary tree, dynamic memory allocation, class, stack and queue. These are what will be mostly included in the final exam. They take you time!! Be prepared!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Cecia's teaching is quite decent. Although it may be a bit simple for those who already have C++ background, she teaches the basic stuff quite detailedly and always give some confusing small question during the lecture(so don't skip lecture). Also, Cecia is quite nice that she would spend a lot of time after class to help you with your PAs, labs, etc..
reviews.comment_grading:
PA1: array, 10%, I got 96/100
PA2: recursion, 12%, I got 94/100(PA2 is usually very difficult, it took me a lot of days and hair...)
PA3: doubly linked list, 15%, I got 97/100
quiz: 10% I got 34/35, 35 MCs, very basic concepts and ask you output given a piece of code, do the self-test quiz in the course web page will help
labs: 10%, I got full marks, they are very simple, just take you one to two hours per week
final exam: 43%, I got 83.5/100, mean is 50 something, final exam is difficult, time consuming and preparation needed, don't think you can finish all of them or they are all in your grasp, be strategic!

Finally my overall is 91/100, got A+. I heard that as long as your overall is above 80, you would can an A range, not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is large. Be prepared of everything.... PAs, exams...

PAs need time to think, plan, implement and debug, don't be ddl fighter, there are a lot of last minute bugs!

Exam can be well prepared by doing simple question about linked list and binary tree on leetcode, class question are usually simple yet they will put in at last!!! So again, be strategic !

reviews.author: Vegetable
reviews.title: Decent Programming Course as Intro to COMP
reviews.comment_content: Please refer to other posts for details. Remember to pay close attention to recursion as it is very useful on handling certain kinds of questions and occurs frequently in both pastpapers and the final of 2021_Spring. The curriculum setting is very fundamental and easy compared to similar courses in other school, so for the students interested in more advanced and challenging topics, you need to spend some time searching for exercises and projects yourselves.
reviews.comment_teaching: Special Credit To Cindy! The pace of her lectures is pretty slow honestly, but she can explain every single concept clearly and also weclomes any question at any time. If she does not remember the exact answer for some very detailed questions about C++ standard, she will reply you the answer after checking the relative documents herself. I am also glad that I get a responsible and patient TA on my lab session. The overall experience as a student of COMP2011 is perfect.
reviews.comment_grading: Please refer to other posts for details. I think the grading of this semester is pretty nice compared to past ones'. Getting almost fullmark on PA and Lab is a necessary but not sufficient condition for most students aiming for A+, unless you do a really good job on final. For the rest of students, don't get too nervous on final. As long as you do the lab and PA BY YOURSELF, I think at least A range is secured. In this semester's final, about half of students are below 40/100. Comparing it to the statistics of PAs, I have sufficient reasons to believe that a large portion of them did not finish the labs and PAs independently. As the exercises provided by the teaching team are far less than enough, please make use of every chance you get, not just wasting them by "Legal Communication To Other Students". According to my friends' and my scores, the overall cutoff between A+ and A should be around 87.
reviews.comment_workload: As I already said in CONTENT part, the workload of this course is pretty light as the lab and PA are really easy, i mean really. The time I spent on checking my PA submissions is twice more than the time spent on writing them (though it is actually not necessary). There is a special point worth being mentioned: write all your codes on txt file and force yourself finish them onethrough because in the exam, you have no opportunity to check your codes by compiling them and no hints about syntax will be given. If you cannot overcome the anxiety during the exam due to the above reasons, you may be crushed and get a suck score. In f2f mode, the coding part is very likely to be hand-written, which also take you some time to get familiar with.

reviews.author: Brian123654
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
我覺得這門課。
这门课只有到了最后一个月才能算开始讲C++的东西，如果前面的pass-by-reference不算的话。。midterm一般水水就过，而我们这一sem final出的特别恶心，本来三个小时的考试时间缩到了两个半小时，而且题量特别大，我做最后的17分只有五分钟了，真的最后手都在抖啊。。。结果交卷的时候最后一面还是完全空着的。。。建议大家以后还是做快一点然后再检查吧，也千万不要被绊住，比如这次倒数第二题linked list，要考虑的小case真的很多，你要是觉得你在短时间内搞不完就一定要先放一放，毕竟后面的分还是有好得的地方。推荐考试前把past paper全刷一遍（虽然我是没时间了。。。）
Brian给规还是挺好的，你要是三百三十个学生里最终能得前十五那么A+还是会有的，Arange我就不知道了，反正这门课Spring Term有百分之四十，而fall term一般都是卷子比较难，给规又比较紧的，2012正好相反。。。
还有，PA一定要好好做，提早做，但也不要太早（比如这次的final第一在PA3一发下来的时候就做了结果傻逼TA给的code里把答案也放进去了，导致PA3后来又被改了。。。然而那时候他已经做好了。。。）也一定不要局限于他给的case和测试方式（我指比如PA3他先乘再除就没有问题，但如果直接除就有问题）。
reviews.comment_teaching: 我覺得教授：上课稍无聊...其实我自己少去上课，也不好评判，至少我去过的我都觉得没啥意思...

Passing Line (total score > X) AND (midterm score * 0.25 + final exam score * 0.40 >= 13) X determined by instructors.
